intro: Cynanchum clavidens subsp. hastifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, and its fruits are follicles containing toxic seeds. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its traditional medicinal uses in some cultures.
